intro: Nonea rosea, commonly known as the roseate daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features showy, pink to lavender-colored ray florets surrounding a central disk of yellow tubular flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and gray-green, with a fuzzy texture. Nonea rosea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
